intro: Cudrania bodinieri, commonly known as the African sandmat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cucurbitaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and distinctive, lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Cudrania bodinieri is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
